channel.title: Adding More than Two Owners? -- 718 --
channel.description:
I'm having an issue adding Two Owners.
I'm not sure how to work this out, But here's the code:
[code]public static final String[] OWNERS = { "detail" }; [/code]
Now, yes, There is "One" Owner, That's me. I want to add my friend to an owner rank, but if I added something like:
[code]public static final String[] OWNERS = { "detail && scripted" }; [/code]
It wouldn't work, how would I add two owners, so it would say Detail And Scripted as owners?
I made this sound very weird, I know. But I just don't understand how.

item.title: Adding More than Two Owners? -- 718 --
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You can also make a method return a string to get the “list” of owners…

public static String getOwners() { String ownerList = ""; for(int i = 0; i < OWNERS.length; i++) { ownerList += (i != OWNERS.length - 1 ? OWNERS[i] + ", " : OWNERS[i]); } return ownerList; }
What that does is it loops through all the Strings in the OWNERS array and adds each String to the ownerList. If the loop its the end of the array (length of array - 1) it only adds the string, if it isn’t, it adds the string with a comma.

[quote=“Output”]Owners: detail, scripted, person #3, person #4
See http://ideone.com/p8SXwL[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Adding More than Two Owners? -- 718 --
item.dc:creator: @InfinityCoughs InfinityCoughs
item.description:
@InfinityCoughs wrote:

Thank you, I’ll try my best to array to learn array.

Please Lock.

item.title: Adding More than Two Owners? -- 718 --
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Learn to array.

public static final String[] OWNERS = { "detail", "scripted", "person #3", "person #4" };
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/arrays.html

Read full topic
